segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: Cyril and Matthieu from [Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/en?utm_source=thisweekinreact) here 👋, standing in for Seb to bring you the latest news from React and React Native!
segments.sourceMdx: Cyril and Matthieu from [Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/en?utm_source=thisweekinreact) here 👋, standing in for Seb to bring you the latest news from React and React Native!
segments.translated_content: 我们是来自[Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/en?utm_source=thisweekinreact)的Cyril和Matthieu 👋，本周暂代Seb为大家带来React和React Native的最新动态！

segments.content: This week we’ve been carefully reading the [State of React 2024](https://2024.stateofreact.com) survey results, and also found quite a few interesting articles. Things have been quieter when it comes to new releases.
segments.sourceMdx: This week we’ve been carefully reading the [State of React 2024](https://2024.stateofreact.com) survey results, and also found quite a few interesting articles. Things have been quieter when it comes to new releases.
segments.translated_content: 本周我们仔细研读了[2024年React现状](https://2024.stateofreact.com)调查报告，同时发现不少精彩文章。不过新版本发布方面相对平静。

segments.content: ## ⚛️ React
segments.sourceMdx: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

segments.content: [![State of React 2024 - Survey Results](/emails/issues/221/state-of-react.png)](https://2024.stateofreact.com)
segments.sourceMdx: [![State of React 2024 - Survey Results](/emails/issues/221/state-of-react.png)](https://2024.stateofreact.com)

segments.content: **[State of React 2024 - Survey Results](https://2024.stateofreact.com)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[State of React 2024 - Survey Results](https://2024.stateofreact.com)**

segments.content: The results of State of React 2024 are out. It is a gold mine of information and we can’t possibly talk about everything here but here are a few highlights:
segments.sourceMdx: The results of State of React 2024 are out. It is a gold mine of information and we can’t possibly talk about everything here but here are a few highlights:
segments.translated_content: 2024年React现状调查报告已出炉。这份信息宝库内容过于丰富，我们无法在此详尽讨论，但以下是几个亮点：

segments.content:
* Of the “new” React features, Server Components are the most popular with 40% of the \~7000 respondents having “used it”, probably thanks to Next.js…
* `forwardRef` is the most disliked React API, and is going away!
* Have you heard about React’s Taint API? It looks like 80% of React devs have not, which is understandable since it’s experimental.
* There’s not that much movement in the #1 spot: Next.js, TanStack Query, Axios, Jest, and Zod are still the most frequently used.
* A few rising stars: Zustand and Vitest got more users, TanStack Start is #1 in interest even though almost no one has used it yet.
segments.sourceMdx:
- Of the “new” React features, Server Components are the most popular with 40% of the ~7000 respondents having “used it”, probably thanks to Next.js…
- `forwardRef` is the most disliked React API, and is going away!
- Have you heard about React’s Taint API? It looks like 80% of React devs have not, which is understandable since it’s experimental.
- There’s not that much movement in the \#1 spot: Next.js, TanStack Query, Axios, Jest, and Zod are still the most frequently used.
- A few rising stars: Zustand and Vitest got more users, TanStack Start is \#1 in interest even though almost no one has used it yet.
segments.translated_content:
- 在"新"React功能中，服务器组件以40%的使用率（约7000名受访者）最受欢迎，这可能要归功于Next.js...
- `forwardRef`成为最不受欢迎的React API，且即将被移除！
- 您听说过React的Taint API吗？约80%的React开发者表示不知情，这可以理解因为它尚处实验阶段。
- 榜首变化不大：Next.js、TanStack Query、Axios、Jest和Zod仍是使用最频繁的工具。
- 几颗上升新星：Zustand和Vitest用户增长显著，TanStack Start虽几乎无人使用却高居"最感兴趣"榜首。

segments.content: Seb wrote the [survey conclusion](https://2024.stateofreact.com/en-US/conclusion/) — be sure to check it out! 🙂
segments.sourceMdx: Seb wrote the [survey conclusion](https://2024.stateofreact.com/en-US/conclusion/) — be sure to check it out! 🙂

segments.content:
* 💸 [Meet Harmony - An open source library for composing consistent and highly performant platforms from independent business features](https://bit.dev/blog/meet-harmony-a-practical-solution-for-composability?utm_source=This-Week-In-React\&utm_id=7\&utm_medium=newsletter)
* 👀 [@rsbuild/plugin-react-router](https://github.com/rspack-contrib/rsbuild-plugin-react-router): Not yet on npm, but may soon be a faster alternative to Vite for bundling React Router apps in framework mode.
* 📜 [How React Router works under the hood](https://tigerabrodi.blog/how-react-router-works-under-the-hood): From initial request to hydration, client-side navigation and actions.
* 📜 [Why I rebuilt ProseMirror’s renderer in React](https://smoores.dev/post/why_i_rebuilt_prosemirror_view/): Prosemirror (a text editor) manages its own state and virtual DOM, and it did not play well with React. This is a deep dive on the issues it caused, and the solution: using React directly instead of trying to “bridge the gap”.
* 📜 [Promises across the void: Streaming data with RSC](https://edspencer.net/2024/7/12/promises-across-the-void-react-server-components): React can send not-yet resolved promises from the server and finish awaiting them on the client. This article from a few months ago explains how this works.
* 📜 [What Do We Do with You, Old React?](https://www.manuelsanchezdev.com/blog/what-to-do-with-old-react-upgrading-to-modern-react): Tips on upgrading codebases that still use class components and “old” Redux.
* 📜 [We Replaced Our React Frontend with Go and WebAssembly](https://dagger.io/blog/replaced-react-with-go): They explain why this was the right choice for them, but probably don’t do this at home.
* 📜 [Handling Relationships in React Admin](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/02/06/handling-relationships-in-react-admin.html): The included components (`<ReferenceField>` and its friends) usually do what you need, but this also explains how to build custom ones.
* 📜 [Create React App Officially Deprecated Amid React 19 Compatibility Issues](https://socket.dev/blog/create-react-app-officially-deprecated?utm_medium=feed): If you’ve not heard about this, catch up with this recap.
* 📜 [How to start a React Project in 2025](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-starter/)
* 📜 [Master Redux Action Best Practices & Make Debugging Easy](https://janhesters.com/blog/master-redux-action-best-practices-and-make-debugging-easy)
* 📦 [React Hook Form resolvers 4.0](https://github.com/react-hook-form/resolvers/releases/tag/v4.0.0): Adds a [standard-schema](https://github.com/standard-schema/standard-schema) resolver, so you can switch easily between validation libraries that conform to the standard-schema specification.
* 📦 [Base UI v1.0.0 alpha 6](https://github.com/mui/base-ui/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.6): This eagerly awaited collection of unstyled components is making its way through the alpha phase
* 🎥 [Jack Herrington - Proof That React With RSCs is 2X Faster!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJvbnNFHx0A)
* 🎙️ [Rocket Ship 60 - Module Federation, RSCs & Universal Apps with Jack Herrington](https://share.transistor.fm/s/144c4947)
segments.sourceMdx:
- 💸 [Meet Harmony - An open source library for composing consistent and highly performant platforms from independent business features](https://bit.dev/blog/meet-harmony-a-practical-solution-for-composability?utm_source=This-Week-In-React&utm_id=7&utm_medium=newsletter)
- 👀 [@rsbuild/plugin-react-router](https://github.com/rspack-contrib/rsbuild-plugin-react-router): Not yet on npm, but may soon be a faster alternative to Vite for bundling React Router apps in framework mode.
- 📜 [How React Router works under the hood](https://tigerabrodi.blog/how-react-router-works-under-the-hood): From initial request to hydration, client-side navigation and actions.
- 📜 [Why I rebuilt ProseMirror’s renderer in React](https://smoores.dev/post/why_i_rebuilt_prosemirror_view/): Prosemirror (a text editor) manages its own state and virtual DOM, and it did not play well with React. This is a deep dive on the issues it caused, and the solution: using React directly instead of trying to “bridge the gap”.
- 📜 [Promises across the void: Streaming data with RSC](https://edspencer.net/2024/7/12/promises-across-the-void-react-server-components): React can send not-yet resolved promises from the server and finish awaiting them on the client. This article from a few months ago explains how this works.
- 📜 [What Do We Do with You, Old React?](https://www.manuelsanchezdev.com/blog/what-to-do-with-old-react-upgrading-to-modern-react): Tips on upgrading codebases that still use class components and “old” Redux.
- 📜 [We Replaced Our React Frontend with Go and WebAssembly](https://dagger.io/blog/replaced-react-with-go): They explain why this was the right choice for them, but probably don’t do this at home.
- 📜 [Handling Relationships in React Admin](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/02/06/handling-relationships-in-react-admin.html): The included components (`<ReferenceField>` and its friends) usually do what you need, but this also explains how to build custom ones.
- 📜 [Create React App Officially Deprecated Amid React 19 Compatibility Issues](https://socket.dev/blog/create-react-app-officially-deprecated?utm_medium=feed): If you’ve not heard about this, catch up with this recap.
- 📜 [How to start a React Project in 2025](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-starter/)
- 📜 [Master Redux Action Best Practices & Make Debugging Easy](https://janhesters.com/blog/master-redux-action-best-practices-and-make-debugging-easy)
- 📦 [React Hook Form resolvers 4.0](https://github.com/react-hook-form/resolvers/releases/tag/v4.0.0): Adds a [standard-schema](https://github.com/standard-schema/standard-schema) resolver, so you can switch easily between validation libraries that conform to the standard-schema specification.
- 📦 [Base UI v1.0.0 alpha 6](https://github.com/mui/base-ui/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.6): This eagerly awaited collection of unstyled components is making its way through the alpha phase
- 🎥 [Jack Herrington \- Proof That React With RSCs is 2X Faster\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJvbnNFHx0A)
- 🎙️ [Rocket Ship 60 \- Module Federation, RSCs & Universal Apps with Jack Herrington](https://share.transistor.fm/s/144c4947)
segments.translated_content:
- 💸 [认识Harmony - 一个用于从独立业务功能组合一致且高性能平台的开源库](https://bit.dev/blog/meet-harmony-a-practical-solution-for-composability?utm_source=This-Week-In-React&utm_id=7&utm_medium=newsletter)
- 👀 [@rsbuild/plugin-react-router](https://github.com/rspack-contrib/rsbuild-plugin-react-router): 尚未发布到npm，但可能很快成为框架模式下打包React Router应用的Vite更快替代方案。
- 📜 [React Router底层工作原理](https://tigerabrodi.blog/how-react-router-works-under-the-hood): 从初始请求到水合，客户端导航和操作。
- 📜 [为什么我在React中重建了ProseMirror的渲染器](https://smoores.dev/post/why_i_rebuilt_prosemirror_view/): ProseMirror（一个文本编辑器）管理自己的状态和虚拟DOM，与React配合不佳。本文深入探讨了由此引发的问题及解决方案：直接使用React而非尝试"弥合鸿沟"。
- 📜 [跨越虚空的承诺：使用RSC流式传输数据](https://edspencer.net/2024/7/12/promises-across-the-void-react-server-components): React可以从服务器发送尚未解析的promise并在客户端完成等待。这篇几个月前的文章解释了其工作原理。
- 📜 [老React，我们该如何处置你？](https://www.manuelsanchezdev.com/blog/what-to-do-with-old-react-upgrading-to-modern-react): 升级仍使用类组件和"旧版"Redux代码库的技巧。
- 📜 [我们用Go和WebAssembly替换了React前端](https://dagger.io/blog/replaced-react-with-go): 他们解释为何这对他们是正确选择，但建议普通人不要轻易尝试。
- 📜 [在React Admin中处理关联关系](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/02/06/handling-relationships-in-react-admin.html): 内置组件（如`<ReferenceField>`等）通常能满足需求，本文也讲解了如何构建自定义组件。
- 📜 [Create React App因React 19兼容性问题正式弃用](https://socket.dev/blog/create-react-app-officially-deprecated?utm_medium=feed): 若你尚未听闻此事，可通过本文回顾。
- 📜 [2025年如何启动React项目](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-starter/)
- 📜 [掌握Redux Action最佳实践 & 简化调试](https://janhesters.com/blog/master-redux-action-best-practices-and-make-debugging-easy)
- 📦 [React Hook Form resolvers 4.0](https://github.com/react-hook-form/resolvers/releases/tag/v4.0.0): 新增[standard-schema](https://github.com/standard-schema/standard-schema)解析器，可轻松切换符合standard-schema规范的验证库。
- 📦 [Base UI v1.0.0 alpha 6](https://github.com/mui/base-ui/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.6): 这套备受期待的无样式组件库正在通过alpha阶段
- 🎥 [Jack Herrington - 证明带RSC的React快2倍！](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJvbnNFHx0A)
- 🎙️ [Rocket Ship 60 - 与Jack Herrington探讨模块联邦、RSC和通用应用](https://share.transistor.fm/s/144c4947)

segments.content: ## 💸 Sponsor

segments.sourceMdx: [![Optimizing Vercel Costs: Real-World Strategies](/emails/issues/221/pagepro.jpg)](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)

segments.content: **[Optimizing Vercel Costs: Real-World Strategies](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter\&utm_medium=email\&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session\&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Optimizing Vercel Costs: Real-World Strategies](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**

segments.content: Deploying Next.js apps on Vercel is easy, but optimizing hosting costs? That’s a different story.
segments.sourceMdx: Deploying Next.js apps on Vercel is easy, but optimizing hosting costs? That’s a different story.
segments.translated_content: 在Vercel上部署Next.js应用很简单，但优化托管成本？那就是另一回事了。

segments.content: Join Chris Lojniewski and Jakub Dakowicz of Pagepro on **February 20th, 11 AM EST** for a deep analysis of Vercel cost optimization strategies. Learn how to identify what drives your costs and reduce them with **code-level optimizations** like adjusting prefetching to avoid excessive function calls, choosing proper rendering methods, and trimming unnecessary data transfers.
segments.sourceMdx: Join Chris Lojniewski and Jakub Dakowicz of Pagepro on **February 20th, 11 AM EST** for a deep analysis of Vercel cost optimization strategies. Learn how to identify what drives your costs and reduce them with **code-level optimizations** like adjusting prefetching to avoid excessive function calls, choosing proper rendering methods, and trimming unnecessary data transfers.
segments.translated_content: 加入Pagepro的Chris Lojniewski和Jakub Dakowicz，参加**2月20日美国东部时间上午11点**的深度分析会，探讨Vercel成本优化策略。学习如何识别成本驱动因素，并通过**代码级优化**（如调整预取策略避免过多函数调用、选择合适的渲染方法、精简不必要的数据传输）来降低成本。

segments.content: They’ll also show you how to **minimize reliance on Vercel’s premium features** with feature externalization - offloading analytics, image optimization, and password protection. Plus, they’ll break down when enterprise pricing is worth considering and when you’re better off with alternatives. **Stop overpaying, and [register today](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter\&utm_medium=email\&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session\&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**.
segments.sourceMdx: They’ll also show you how to **minimize reliance on Vercel’s premium features** with feature externalization - offloading analytics, image optimization, and password protection. Plus, they’ll break down when enterprise pricing is worth considering and when you’re better off with alternatives. **Stop overpaying, and [register today](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**.
segments.translated_content: 他们还将展示如何通过**功能外移**（将分析、图像优化和密码保护等任务转移到外部服务）来**减少对Vercel付费功能的依赖**。此外，他们将剖析何时值得考虑企业级定价方案，何时选择替代方案更划算。**立即[注册参会](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)，停止超额付费**。

segments.content: ## 📱 React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: [![Bolt x Expo](/emails/issues/221/bolt-expo.jpg)](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Bolt x Expo](/emails/issues/221/bolt-expo.jpg)](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)

segments.content: **Building apps with AI**
segments.sourceMdx: **Building apps with AI**

segments.content: We don't talk too much about LLMs in this newsletter (we guess you already hear about it more than enough 😅) but with all the announcements this week we thought it was a good time to give you an update.
segments.sourceMdx: We don't talk too much about LLMs in this newsletter (we guess you already hear about it more than enough 😅) but with all the announcements this week we thought it was a good time to give you an update.
segments.translated_content: 我们通常不会在本简报中过多讨论LLM（毕竟你们可能已经听得够多了😅），但鉴于本周的密集公告，我们认为有必要同步最新动态。

segments.content: The big news: **[Bolt and Expo have partnered](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)** to add (React-)Native mobile apps support to Bolt. Right now you can preview your AI-generated apps on the web, but you need to download the code to go further. They plan to add an integration with EAS to deploy to production in the future.
segments.sourceMdx: The big news: **[Bolt and Expo have partnered](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)** to add (React-)Native mobile apps support to Bolt. Right now you can preview your AI-generated apps on the web, but you need to download the code to go further. They plan to add an integration with EAS to deploy to production in the future.
segments.translated_content: 重磅消息：**[Bolt与Expo达成合作](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)**，为Bolt添加(React-)Native移动应用支持。目前用户可在网页端预览AI生成的应用，但进一步开发仍需下载代码。未来计划通过EAS集成实现生产环境部署。

segments.content: Some competitors also had things to announce:
segments.sourceMdx: Some competitors also had things to announce:

segments.content:
* There's now an official Expo template in Replit, and [a demo video you can watch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk). Replit has an app, so you can build apps from an app.
* A startup called a0 [launched a v0-like service](https://a0.dev) to generate RN apps.
segments.sourceMdx:
- There's now an official Expo template in Replit, and [a demo video you can watch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk). Replit has an app, so you can build apps from an app.
- A startup called a0 [launched a v0-like service](https://a0.dev) to generate RN apps.
segments.translated_content:
- Replit现提供官方Expo模板，并发布[演示视频](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk)。由于Replit自带应用，现在可以通过应用来构建应用。
- 初创公司a0推出[类v0服务](https://a0.dev)，支持生成React Native应用。

segments.content:
* 💸 [Codemagic - a great App Center alternative for React Native devs! 8x faster builds, CodePush, automated distribution. 1-month free trial!](https://codemagic.io/migration-from-app-center/?utm_source=newsletter\&utm_medium=email\&utm_campaign=app_center_this_week_react)
* 🐦 [This is not React Native](https://x.com/mrousavy/status/1889358737930068051): Mark is working on a new UI library based based React, JSI and NitroModules but **without** React Native. It uses SwiftUI and Compose under the hood.
* 🐦 [DeepSeek R1 running locally in a React App:](https://x.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1889412928694002004) The repo is open-sourced [here](https://github.com/callstackincubator/ai). Please note that it is highly experimental and may add up to 1GB to your app.
* 👀 [Expo Universal React Server Components + AI chat app demo](https://github.com/EvanBacon/expo-ai): Evan Bacon just open-sourced the app he demoed on various conf talks.
* 💬 [React Strict DOM - Production readiness and adoption](https://github.com/facebook/react-strict-dom/discussions/270): Nicolas Gallagher shared an interesting update, mentioning RSD is used in production by Meta.
* 🗓 [React Universe Conf](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=RUC2025\&utm_source=TWIRpartnership\&utm_content=savethedate) - 🇵🇱 Wrocław - 2-4 September. Call for Papers is now open! Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
* 📜 [Bringing WebAssembly to React Native With Polygen](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bringing-webassembly-to-react-native-with-polygen): Polygen allows WebAssembly to run in React Native with near-native performance by compiling modules to native code, overcoming iOS JIT restrictions. This is a novel approach compared to existing solutions like react-native-webassembly, which relied on Wasm interpretation.
* 📜 [Increase your Expo-nent power with Ignite Generators](https://expo.dev/blog/increase-your-expo-power-with-ignite-generators): Ignite is a well known React Native app boilerplate, but it can be leveraged as a generator in any React Native project, including Expo apps, to automate the creation of screens, components, and state slices.
* 📜 [How does React Native's New Architecture affect performance?](https://dev.to/anishamalde/how-does-react-natives-new-architecture-affect-performance-1dkf): Anisha conducted a benchmark revealing performance improvements of up to 1000ms when enabling the New Architecture for a React Native TV app, where performance is crucial.
* 📜 [Bridgeless Native Development](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bridgeless-native-development): Short summary of the methods used over the years to bridge native code (NativeModule, TurboModule, NitroModule).
* 📜 [How to Profile Native Code in React Native Using Tracy](https://www.callstack.com/blog/how-to-profile-native-code-react-native-with-tracy)
* 📜 [How to build a live activity with Expo, SwiftUI and React Native](https://christopher.engineering/en/blog/live-activity-with-react-native/)
* 📦 [Radon IDE v1.3](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.3.0): built-in Network Inspector, Redux DevTools support, debugger improvements.
* 📦 [React Native Gesture Handler v2.23](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-gesture-handler/releases/tag/2.23.0): The old API will be deprecated.
* 📦 [React Native macOS v0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/releases/tag/react-native-macos%400.77.0)
* 📦 [React Native Reanimated Carousel v4.0](https://rn-carousel.dev/migration-v4): Container Styling, Minimum Scroll Distance, Fixed Direction Scrolling, Progress Change Handling, Enhanced Pagination Components, Improved Web Support.
* 🎙️ [RNR 321 - Expo DOM with Evan Bacon](https://www.reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-321-expo-dom-with-evan-bacon)

- 💸 [Codemagic - a great App Center alternative for React Native devs! 8x faster builds, CodePush, automated distribution. 1-month free trial!](https://codemagic.io/migration-from-app-center/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=app_center_this_week_react)
- 🐦 [This is not React Native](https://x.com/mrousavy/status/1889358737930068051): Mark is working on a new UI library based based React, JSI and NitroModules but **without** React Native. It uses SwiftUI and Compose under the hood.
- 🐦 [DeepSeek R1 running locally in a React App:](https://x.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1889412928694002004) The repo is open-sourced [here](https://github.com/callstackincubator/ai). Please note that it is highly experimental and may add up to 1GB to your app.
- 👀 [Expo Universal React Server Components + AI chat app demo](https://github.com/EvanBacon/expo-ai): Evan Bacon just open-sourced the app he demoed on various conf talks.
- 💬 [React Strict DOM - Production readiness and adoption](https://github.com/facebook/react-strict-dom/discussions/270): Nicolas Gallagher shared an interesting update, mentioning RSD is used in production by Meta.
- 🗓 [React Universe Conf](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=RUC2025&utm_source=TWIRpartnership&utm_content=savethedate) \- 🇵🇱 Wrocław - 2-4 September. Call for Papers is now open! Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
- 📜 [Bringing WebAssembly to React Native With Polygen](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bringing-webassembly-to-react-native-with-polygen): Polygen allows WebAssembly to run in React Native with near-native performance by compiling modules to native code, overcoming iOS JIT restrictions. This is a novel approach compared to existing solutions like react-native-webassembly, which relied on Wasm interpretation.
- 📜 [Increase your Expo-nent power with Ignite Generators](https://expo.dev/blog/increase-your-expo-power-with-ignite-generators): Ignite is a well known React Native app boilerplate, but it can be leveraged as a generator in any React Native project, including Expo apps, to automate the creation of screens, components, and state slices.
- 📜 [How does React Native's New Architecture affect performance?](https://dev.to/anishamalde/how-does-react-natives-new-architecture-affect-performance-1dkf): Anisha conducted a benchmark revealing performance improvements of up to 1000ms when enabling the New Architecture for a React Native TV app, where performance is crucial.
- 📜 [Bridgeless Native Development](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bridgeless-native-development): Short summary of the methods used over the years to bridge native code (NativeModule, TurboModule, NitroModule).
- 📜 [How to Profile Native Code in React Native Using Tracy](https://www.callstack.com/blog/how-to-profile-native-code-react-native-with-tracy)
- 📜 [How to build a live activity with Expo, SwiftUI and React Native](https://christopher.engineering/en/blog/live-activity-with-react-native/)
- 📦 [Radon IDE v1.3](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.3.0): built-in Network Inspector, Redux DevTools support, debugger improvements.
- 📦 [React Native Gesture Handler v2.23](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-gesture-handler/releases/tag/2.23.0): The old API will be deprecated.
- 📦 [React Native macOS v0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/releases/tag/react-native-macos%400.77.0)
- 📦 [React Native Reanimated Carousel v4.0](https://rn-carousel.dev/migration-v4): Container Styling, Minimum Scroll Distance, Fixed Direction Scrolling, Progress Change Handling, Enhanced Pagination Components, Improved Web Support.
- 🎙️ [RNR 321 \- Expo DOM with Evan Bacon](https://www.reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-321-expo-dom-with-evan-bacon)
segments.translated_content:
- 💸 [Codemagic - React Native 开发者的绝佳 App Center 替代方案！构建速度提升 8 倍，支持 CodePush 和自动化分发。提供 1 个月免费试用！](https://codemagic.io/migration-from-app-center/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=app_center_this_week_react)
- 🐦 [这不是 React Native](https://x.com/mrousavy/status/1889358737930068051)：Mark 正在开发一个基于 React、JSI 和 NitroModules 的新 UI 库，但**不依赖** React Native。底层使用 SwiftUI 和 Compose。
- 🐦 [在 React 应用中本地运行 DeepSeek R1：](https://x.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1889412928694002004) 代码已开源[此处](https://github.com/callstackincubator/ai)。请注意这是高度实验性项目，可能使应用体积增加高达 1GB。
- 👀 [Expo 通用 React Server Components + AI 聊天应用演示](https://github.com/EvanBacon/expo-ai)：Evan Bacon 刚刚开源了他在多个技术大会上演示的应用。
- 💬 [React Strict DOM - 生产环境就绪与采用情况](https://github.com/facebook/react-strict-dom/discussions/270)：Nicolas Gallagher 分享了重要更新，提到 Meta 已在生产环境使用 RSD。
- 🗓 [React Universe 大会](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=RUC2025&utm_source=TWIRpartnership&utm_content=savethedate) \- 🇵🇱 波兰弗罗茨瓦夫 - 9月2-4日。征稿现已开放！使用优惠码 "TWIR" 可享 10% 折扣。
- 📜 [通过 Polygen 将 WebAssembly 引入 React Native](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bringing-webassembly-to-react-native-with-polygen)：Polygen 通过将模块编译为原生代码，使 WebAssembly 在 React Native 中以接近原生性能运行，克服了 iOS 的 JIT 限制。相比 react-native-webassembly 等依赖 Wasm 解释的现有方案，这是创新性突破。
- 📜 [用 Ignite Generators 增强你的 Expo 开发能力](https://expo.dev/blog/increase-your-expo-power-with-ignite-generators)：Ignite 是知名的 React Native 应用样板，但它也可以作为生成器用于任何 React Native 项目（包括 Expo 应用），自动创建屏幕、组件和状态切片。
- 📜 [React Native 新架构如何影响性能？](https://dev.to/anishamalde/how-does-react-natives-new-architecture-affect-performance-1dkf)：Anisha 的基准测试显示，在 React Native TV 应用（性能至关重要）中启用新架构可获得高达 1000ms 的性能提升。
- 📜 [无桥接原生开发](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bridgeless-native-development)：简要总结多年来桥接原生代码的方法演进（NativeModule, TurboModule, NitroModule）。
- 📜 [如何使用 Tracy 分析 React Native 中的原生代码](https://www.callstack.com/blog/how-to-profile-native-code-react-native-with-tracy)
- 📜 [如何用 Expo、SwiftUI 和 React Native 构建实时活动](https://christopher.engineering/en/blog/live-activity-with-react-native/)
- 📦 [Radon IDE v1.3](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.3.0)：内置网络检查器、Redux DevTools 支持、调试器改进。
- 📦 [React Native Gesture Handler v2.23](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-gesture-handler/releases/tag/2.23.0)：旧 API 即将弃用。
- 📦 [React Native macOS v0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/releases/tag/react-native-macos%400.77.0)
- 📦 [React Native Reanimated Carousel v4.0](https://rn-carousel.dev/migration-v4)：容器样式、最小滚动距离、固定方向滚动、进度变化处理、增强分页组件、改进的 Web 支持。
- 🎙️ [RNR 321 期 - 与 Evan Bacon 探讨 Expo DOM](https://www.reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-321-expo-dom-with-evan-bacon)

segments.content: ## 🔀 Other
segments.sourceMdx: ## 🔀 Other {#other}

segments.content:
* 👀 [`require(esm)` has been backported to Node.js 20](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/56927)
* 📜 [TypeScript: the `satisfies` operator](https://2ality.com/2025/02/satisfies-operator.html): Confirming object shape correctness without altering types, validating optional properties in objects, checking the structure of enum-like objects, ensuring proper object keys for APIs and more…
* 📜 [There are a lot of ways to break up long tasks in JavaScript](https://macarthur.me/posts/long-tasks/)
* 📜 [Style-observer: JS to observe CSS property changes, for reals](https://lea.verou.me/blog/2025/style-observer/)
* 📜 [Optimizing Images for Web Performance](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/optimizing-images-for-web-performance/)
* 📜 [CSS Custom Functions experiments in Chrome Canary](https://www.bram.us/2025/02/09/css-custom-functions-teaser/)
* 📦 [Prettier 3.5 - TS config file, `objectWrap` option, `experimentalOperatorPosition` option](https://prettier.io/blog/2025/02/09/3.5.0)
* 📦 [esbuild 0.25 - Various fixes and some backwards-incompatible changes](https://github.com/evanw/esbuild/releases/tag/v0.25.0)

- 📜 [TypeScript: the `satisfies` operator](https://2ality.com/2025/02/satisfies-operator.html): Confirming object shape correctness without altering types, validating optional properties in objects, checking the structure of enum-like objects, ensuring proper object keys for APIs and more…
- 📜 [There are a lot of ways to break up long tasks in JavaScript](https://macarthur.me/posts/long-tasks/)
- 📜 [Style-observer: JS to observe CSS property changes, for reals](https://lea.verou.me/blog/2025/style-observer/)

segments.translated_content:
- 👀 [`require(esm)` 已向后移植到 Node.js 20](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/56927)
- 📜 [TypeScript: `satisfies` 运算符](https://2ality.com/2025/02/satisfies-operator.html)：在不改变类型的情况下确认对象形状正确性，验证对象中的可选属性，检查枚举类对象的结构，确保 API 的键名正确性等...
- 📜 [JavaScript 中有许多方法可以拆分长任务](https://macarthur.me/posts/long-tasks/)
- 📜 [Style-observer: 真正观测 CSS 属性变化的 JS 方案](https://lea.verou.me/blog/2025/style-observer/)
- 📜 [为网页性能优化图片](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/optimizing-images-for-web-performance/)
- 📜 [Chrome Canary 中的 CSS 自定义函数实验](https://www.bram.us/2025/02/09/css-custom-functions-teaser/)
- 📦 [Prettier 3.5 - TS 配置文件支持、`objectWrap` 选项、`experimentalOperatorPosition` 选项](https://prettier.io/blog/2025/02/09/3.5.0)
- 📦 [esbuild 0.25 - 多项修复及部分不兼容变更](https://github.com/evanw/esbuild/releases/tag/v0.25.0)
